com.ojcoleman.bain.neuron.rate

Class RisiModulatoryNeuronCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
      • com.ojcoleman.bain.base.ComponentCollection
        • com.ojcoleman.bain.base.ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>
          • com.ojcoleman.bain.base.NeuronCollection<C>
            • com.ojcoleman.bain.neuron.rate.NeuronCollectionWithBias<SigmoidNeuronConfiguration>
              • com.ojcoleman.bain.neuron.rate.SigmoidBipolarNeuronCollection
                • com.ojcoleman.bain.neuron.rate.RisiModulatoryNeuronCollection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentConfigurationListener, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class RisiModulatoryNeuronCollection
extends SigmoidBipolarNeuronCollection
    Implements the neuron model described by S. Risi, K.O. Stanley (2012) A UniÔ¨Åed Approach to Evolving Plasticity and Neural Geometry. This model must be used in combination with RisiModulatorySynapseCollection
    Author:
    Oliver J. Coleman

    • Field Detail

      • modInputs

        protected double[] modInputs
        The current synaptic plasticity modulation inputs for the neurons.

      • modBias

        protected double[] modBias
        The bias value for synaptic plasticity modulation for each neuron.

      • modActivations

        protected double[] modActivations
        The current synaptic plasticity modulation activation level for the neurons. This is used as a factor in determining the current plasticity of the incoming synapses.

      • modBiasModified

        protected boolean modBiasModified
        Flag to indicate if any of the modulatory bias values have been modified since the last step. This is used to determine if we need to put() the NeuronCollectionWithBias.bias array/buffer when using OpenCL.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RisiModulatoryNeuronCollection

        public RisiModulatoryNeuronCollection()
        Create an empty RisiModulatorySigmoidNeuronCollection. This is used for retrieving a singleton to create a non-empty collection with.

        size - The size of this collection.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Initialise the collection. This method should be called from a sub-classes constructor. Sub-classes should override this method to generate pre-calculated values used during the simulation, and call this super-method. Arrays/buffers initialised here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        init in class SigmoidBipolarNeuronCollection

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: NeuronCollection
        Reset the components to their initial state. Sub-classes should override this method if they have state variables that may be reset to an initial state. Arrays/buffers reset here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put(). The implementation of this method in NeuronCollection resets the values for ComponentCollection.outputs, NeuronCollection.spikings and NeuronCollection.inputs to 0. If any of these values should be set to something other than 0, then this method should be overridden, and this super-method called from the overriding method before setting the values to the correct value and calling put([modified array]) with the relevant array.
        Overrides:
        reset in class NeuronCollection<SigmoidNeuronConfiguration>

      • setBias

        public void setBias(int neuronIndex,
           double b)
        Set the modulatory bias for the given neuron.
        Overrides:
        setBias in class NeuronCollectionWithBias<SigmoidNeuronConfiguration>

      • step

        public void step()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Update the model over one time step. Sub-classes should call this super method. The step() method will invoke the overridden run() method which defines the Aparapi kernel. This method sets ComponentCollection.stateVariablesStale and ComponentCollection.outputsStale to true.
        Overrides:
        step in class NeuronCollectionWithBias<SigmoidNeuronConfiguration>

      • run

        public void run()
        Description copied from class: NeuronCollection
        Implements the basic infrastructure for processing a neuron by resetting the value of NeuronCollection.inputs and setting the value for NeuronCollection.spikings. Sub-classes must override this method and call the super-method after they have made use of the value in NeuronCollection.inputs to generate a value for ComponentCollection.outputs. Alternatively, if NeuronCollection.inputs should be reset to something other than 0 or a neuron spike is represented by something other than a value greater than 0 in ComponentCollection.outputs, then this super-method need not be called and the overriding method should instead reset the values for NeuronCollection.inputs AND set the value for NeuronCollection.spikings.
        Overrides:
        run in class SigmoidBipolarNeuronCollection

      • createCollection

        public ComponentCollection createCollection(int size)
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Create a new collection of this type of the given size. Implementations of this method should call ComponentCollection.init().
        Overrides:
        createCollection in class SigmoidBipolarNeuronCollection
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the new collection.

      • ensureInputsAreFresh

        public void ensureInputsAreFresh()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Ensures the inputs, as provided by ComponentCollection.getInput(int index) and ComponentCollection.getInputs() have been fetched from the remote execution hardware (eg GPU) if necessary. See ComponentCollection.inputsAreStale().
        Overrides:
        ensureInputsAreFresh in class NeuronCollection<SigmoidNeuronConfiguration>

        Overrides:
